meanings.def: material made by weaving wool, cotton, silk, etc., used for making clothes, curtains, etc. and for covering furniture
examples: They sell a wide variety of printed cotton fabric.
furnishing fabrics
cotton fabric
furnishing fabrics
His bandages had been made from strips of cloth.
‘What material is this dress made of?’ ‘Cotton.’
He owns a factory producing a range of textiles.
the textile industry
The fabric is woven on these machines.
fabric swatches of the different types of mattress covering
rich fabric wall coverings

meanings.def: the basic structure of a society, an organization, etc. that enables it to function successfully
examples: a trend which threatens the very fabric of society
the structure of the building/​human body
the social structure of society
the grammatical structures of a language
a salary structure
The report provides a framework for further research.
As a photographer, shape and form were more important to him than colour.
recent changes in the composition of the workforce
ships of steel construction
This is a trend which threatens the very fabric of society.
The government's policies have destroyed the social fabric.
the basic fabric of family life

meanings.def: the basic structure of a building, such as the walls, floor and roof
examples: The city retains much of its historic fabric.
